page.title: 11HAWK LAKE LOWER HEATH
page.content: Hawk Lake is a long,narrow,{man-made lake about 2miles long most of which falls within our Domesday Block.The lake was originally made when the grounds of{Hawkstone Hall}were {landscaped.}The south west bank is {open parkland}running down to the lake but the the north-east bank is marked by a narrow strip of{woodland,}mostly {alders and sycamores}planted on top of the{dam.}This strip is about 50 feet higher than the surrounding farmland. The lake is edged with{reeds}and {yellow iris}and{coots,ducks}and {moorhens}nest there.The lake is not used now for boating although there is a disused boathouse on the south bank. The{angling}rights are owned by Wem {Anglers' Club.}The fish mostly caught is{carp.}There is a small{caravan site at the north end of lake and a {footpath}along the top of the dam.
